questions.question: What is the relationship between winpercent and other two dimensions in chocolate candy group.

answer.value: There exists a iinverse Relationship between Win Percent and Price Percent and  lack of Clear Correlation between Sugar and Popularity.

key_insights: The orange lines (chocolate) generally show a higher concentration of high winpercent values compared to the blue lines.
Non-chocolate candies (blue) show a wider spread in popularity, ranging from very low to medium-high
High Popularity, Low Cost: Many of the lines with high Win Percent values (closer to the top of the middle axis) correspond to lower Price Percent values (towards the bottom of the right axis).
The lines are widely spread across the Sugar Percent axis (leftmost axis), ranging from very low (bottom) to very high (top).

reasoning.reasoning: We care about the relationship between winpercent and other two dimensions, putting winpercent in the middle can help to show the relationship.
We focus on chocolate candy group.
